clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Characteristics and Outcome of Patients With COPD With Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Study on the Clinical Characteristics and Outcome of Patients With COPD Combined With Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: To identify the clinical characteristics of patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) combined with community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) and the factors influencing clinical transition.

detailed_description.textblock: To identify the clinical characteristics of patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) combined with community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) and the factors influencing clinical transition.Compared to other chronic airway diseases, COPD patients can often have CAP in combination, but there is a lack of comparative studies between COPD patients with CAP and non-COPD patients with CAP.

arm_group.description: (1) CAP meets the diagnostic criteria published in our 2016 CAP diagnosis and treatment guidelines; CPOPD and AECOPD meet the diagnostic criteria published in our 2013 COPD diagnosis and treatment guidelines; (2) age ≧ 18 years. Exclusion criteria: (1) age <18 years; (2) pregnancy; (3) positive human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antibody; (4) suspected or confirmed tuberculosis or fungal infection of the lung.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with COPD combined with pneumonia admitted to Peking University Third Hospital from March 1, 2017 to February 28, 2018
